project.teaser: There is a large body of evidence demonstrating that effective teamwork by healthcare teams is crucial to maintain safe and effective patient care in complex care contexts. Complexity of healthcare is rapidly increasing due to technological innovation, increasing healthcare...
project.title: Tools4Teams: Research Training to Design and Implement Tools Supporting Safe Teamwork in Healthcare
project.keywords: complex health care systems, multiprofessional teamwork, patient safety, acute hospital care, chronic care, community care, human-centered design, teamtraining, non-technical skills, implementation

article.title: It’s all about teamwork – on the playing field and at the hospital

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - Tools4Teams (Tools4Teams: Research Training to Design and Implement Tools Supporting Safe Teamwork in Healthcare)
result.teaser: Teamwork is crucial to maintain safe and effective care There is ample evidence that effective teamwork is crucial to the provision of safe and effective patient care. In the last decade significant progress has been made to describe cognitive, affective, and behavioral team...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Behavioral sciences applied to acute care teams: a research agenda for the years ahead by a European research network

details.authors: Sandra Keller, Judith G. M. Jelsma, Franziska Tschan, Nick Sevdalis, Ruth M. Löllgen, Johan Creutzfeldt, Lauren R. Kennedy-Metz, Walter Eppich, Norbert K. Semmer, Isabelle Van Herzeele, Karin Pukk Härenstam & Martine C. de Bruijne

result.title: Press and media strategy including international press pack
result.description: Press and media strategy including international press pack

result.title: First Plan for Dissemination and Exploitation of results, including communication activities
result.description: Plan for Dissemination and Exploitation of results, including communication activities

result.title: Interim publication of guidelines WP4
result.description: interim report on publication of guidelines for design and implementation of tools for acute care teams in training (DC 5, 6, 10) and practice (DC 1, 2, 3, 4, 12)

result.title: Interim publication of scientific reports WP5
result.description: Interim report on publication of scientific reports on literature reviews (DC 6,7,8), implementation of remote monitoring (DC 6,11) and evaluation of support tools (DC 7, 8, 9, 11) in peer reviewed journals

result.title: Interim publication of scientific report WP4
result.description: interim report on publication of scientific reports on literature reviews (ESR 1, 4, 10, 12), assessing (ESR 2, 3, 5, 10) and reflecting on teamwork dynamics (ESR 1, 4, 5) in peer reviewed journals

result.title: Interim publication of guidelines WP5
result.description: interim report on publication of guidelines for design and implementation of tools for decentralized chronic care teams (DC 7, 8) and participative design (DC 9, 11) and for safe monitoring of patients in community health care settings (DC 6, 11)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
